about DesignAnd.VC…
How design and venture capital (VC) work together

about …

First of all, Lisa Katayama helped me get this project started, along with Cliff Kuang and Sheel Mohnot. Lisa led a brainstorming session on November 18, 2015 in San Francisco to determine what kind of content crossing design and the VC worldcould be gathered. That link is here.

I guess I’m a “fire, ready, aim” kind of person, so I decided to see what can get made, and iterate as we go. I asked a few of my colleagues in the venture capital space if they might answer a few standard questions derived from our November brainstorming work, and also from my own personal experience in the VC world at KPCB.

Designers that participated in this mini-study, in order of getting their answers into me within the wee hours left in 2015, are:

  • Irene Au / Khosla Ventures
  • Elizabeth Weil / Andreesen Horowitz

If you are a designer working in the VC space and would like to be added to the list, please drop me a line. It might take me a while to get back to you so please be patient. Placing “DesignAnd.VC: New designer” in the subject line will help me find you.

—John Maeda (designandvc@gmail.com)

PS It took me three hours to figure out how to get this site together. If not for a post by Barry Clark, I probably would have given up by the end of the second hour. Visit Barry’s resource to save yourself at least two hours (or more) of being lost in GitHub’s documentation pages.
